universe – Universe filters¶

universe.base¶

class orca.universe.base.FilterBase(debug_on=True, datetime_index=True, reindex=True, date_check=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for filters.

Parameters:
  • debug_on (boolean) – Enable/Disable debug level messages. Default: True
  • datetime_index (boolean) – Whether to use DatetimeIndex or list of date strings. Default: False
  • reindex (boolean) – Whether to use full sids as columns in DataFrame. Default: False
  • date_check (boolean) – Whethter to check if passed date-related parameters are valid. Default: False

Note

This is a base class and should not be used directly.

__metaclass__¶

alias of ABCMeta

set_debug_mode(debug_on)[source]¶

Enable/Disable debug level message in data fetchers. This is enabled by default.

debug(msg)[source]¶

Logs a message with level DEBUG on the alpha logger.

info(msg)[source]¶

Logs a message with level INFO on the alpha logger.

warning(msg)[source]¶

Logs a message with level WARNING on the alpha logger.

error(msg)[source]¶

Logs a message with level ERROR on the alpha logger.

critical(msg)[source]¶

Logs a message with level CRITICAL on the alpha logger.

filter(startdate, enddate=None, parent=None, return_parent=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Override (mandatory) to filter out a universe within two endpoints.

Parameters:
  • startdate (str, int) – The left (may not be the actual) endpoint
  • enddate (str, int, None) – The right endpoint. Default: None, defaults to the last date
  • parent (DataFrame) – The super- or parent-universe to be filtered. Default: None
  • return_parent (boolean) – Whether to return parent along with the universe
Returns:

DataFrame(if return_parent is False), or a tuple with the 2nd element the formatted parent DataFrame
Raises:

NotImplementedError
filter_daily(date, offset=0, parent=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Filter out a universe on a certain day. A helper method.

Parameters:
  • date (str, int) – The base point
  • offset (int) – The offset w.r.t. the date. The actual date is calculated from date and offset. Default: 0
  • parent (DataFrame) – The super- or parent-universe to be filtered. Default: None
Returns:

Series
class orca.universe.base.DataFilter(datas, synth, window, rule=None, delay=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.universe.base.FilterBase

Base class for filters based on data(s).

Parameters:
  • datas (list) – Its element is 2/3-tuple as (dname, fetcherclass[, kwargs]). The purpose is to instantiate a fetcher object by calling fetcherclass(**kwargs) and then use the fetching methods to fetch data dname
  • synth (function) – Function to synthesis these fetched datas
  • window (int) – Used as in pd.rolling_apply(arg, window, ...). It is also used in determining data fetching window, thus is worthy to be seperated from rule
  • rule (function) – When called in rule(window), it returns a function that can be applied on DataFrame objects. Thus rule(window)(df) should be equivalent to pd.rolling_apply(df, window, func, ...)
  • delay (int) – Delay of the underlying data. Default: 1, which means, loosely speaking, universe on DATES[di] is filtered out using datas up to DATES[di-1]
class orca.universe.base.SimpleDataFilter(data, window, rule=None, delay=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.universe.base.DataFilter

Base class for filters based on a single data.

Parameters:data (tuple) – Like (dname, fetcherclass[, kwargs])

universe.ops¶

class orca.universe.ops.ChainFilter(filters, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.universe.base.FilterBase

Class to filter out a universe chainly.

Parameters:filters (list) – List of filters to go through; each item is either a filter itself or a tuple of filters. Each filterd universe serves as the parent universe for remainders

Note

The keyword parameter reindex is always coerced to be True.

class orca.universe.ops.NegateFilter(filter, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.universe.base.FilterBase

Class to negate a filter.

Parameters:filter – Filter to be negated
class orca.universe.ops.UnionFilter(filters, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.universe.base.FilterBase

Class to union the universes filtered by two seperate filters.

Parameters:filters – List of filters to be unioned. Each item must be a filter itself

Note

The keyword parameter reindex is always coerced to be True.

universe.special¶

class orca.universe.special.TickerFilter(rule=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.universe.base.FilterBase

Class to filter out stocks by ticker patterns. Usually, stock ticker pattern contains information about its listed market.

Parameters:rule (function) – String manipulation function
class orca.universe.special.TradingDaysFilter(window, rule=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.universe.base.SimpleDataFilter

Class to filter out stocks by their active trading history. In particular, this can filter new IPO stocks.

Parameters:rule (function) – Rule like: orca.universe.rules.count_gt()
class orca.universe.special.ActiveFilter(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.universe.base.SimpleDataFilter

Class to filter out stocks when they are suspended.

class orca.universe.special.ComponentsFilter(index, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.universe.base.SimpleDataFilter

Class to filter out stocks that are components in an index.

Parameters:index (str) – Index name, currently only supports: (‘HS300’, ‘CS500’, ‘CS800’, ‘SH50’)
class orca.universe.special.IndustryFilter(industry, standard='SW2014', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.universe.base.SimpleDataFilter

Class to filter out stocks based on their industry classification.

Parameters:
  • industry (list) – Indutries that should be included in the universe
  • standard (str) – Industry classification standard, currently only supports: (‘SW2014’, ‘ZX’). Default: ‘SW2014’

orca.universe.factory.create_cap_filter(clsname, shares)[source]¶
Parameters:shares (str) – Shares definition, must be one of the following 6: (‘a_shares’, ‘a_float’, ‘a_float_listed’, ‘a_float_nonrestricted’, ‘a_float_restricted’, ‘float_shares’). Default: ‘a_float_nonrestricted’)
